title: Jeweller Henrik Saugbjerg
summary: Dynamic web solution combined with a SoMe content strategy. Second semester exam project
description: The company already had an established customer base, but was struggling to connect with a younger audience. To address this issue, we focused on creating a solution based on an understanding of the user, and we employed a SoMe campaign targeting a younger demographic with creative hobbies and interests such as jewelry making. We generated content dynamically by importing information from an external data source about the jewelry making courses that the company offers.

title: Snack & hund
summary: Design and layout project for a cookbook writer. Freelance work
description: Over the course of this project, I grew very familiar with In Design, and I gained a greater understanding of the processes involved in publishing a book. The project tasks included proofreading, design and composition work, and layout for the entire book, including the cover.

title: The Tranbjerg Symphony
summary: Short educational project focused on the use of external data sources. Third semester
description: A fictitious symphonic orchestra was looking for a solution to keep track of their musicians. Therefore, the site needed to include a search function, as well as functions to show all musicians, delete musicians, and create new musicians.

title: AFS Intercultural Programs
summary: Web doc for a non-profit organisation focusing on international relations
description: An exiting group project with an emphasis on cooperation across disciplines and a solid understanding of the needs of the user. We employed storytelling for the web doc, created a supplementary SoMe campaign strategy, and pitched our product to the client in a professional setting.

title: Amo
summary: Responsive web solution. First semester exam project
description: Here, I singled out potential new target groups for an already established brand, and I worked to meet their needs and wishes. As a consequence, the site provides information about Amo's proposed new line of organic products, and families with children can test their baking knowledge with a fun quiz.
